item.title: Bybitâ€™s $1.4 Billion ETH Hack and the Need for ARMUR
item.description: The cryptocurrency industry was shaken on February 21, 2025, when Bybit, confirmed a hack resulting in the loss of approximately $1.4 billion in Ethereum (ETH) and related tokens, marking it as the largest cryptocurrency theft in history. This incident, detailed in various reports, underscores the escalating sophistication of cyber attacks, particularly those leveraging artificial intelligence (AI). The user’s request to write an article for Armur AI (armur.ai) provides an opportunity to analyze this breach and advocate for their AI-powered cybersecurity solution, ARMUR, as a critical defense mechanism for tech firms.
